title: Romantic Valentine proposal page with evasive No button and Yes-triggered meme

requirements.text: Create a single-page interactive Valentine prompt that asks the user (girlfriend) to be the user’s Valentine, with two visible options: “Yes” and “No”, using English for all user-facing text.

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... ask her to be my Valentine.
There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: The page displays a clear question asking the user to be the Valentine.
Two buttons are present and labeled exactly “Yes” and “No”.
All visible text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement evasive behavior for the “No” button: on hover (and on touch interaction equivalents for iPad), the “No” button should move to a new position within the viewport/container such that it is difficult/impossible to click, while keeping the UI responsive and not moving off-screen.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: Hovering over the “No” button causes it to move away before a click can be completed.
On iPad/Chrome, the “No” button also evades touch interactions (e.g., on touchstart/pointerdown) in a comparable way.
The “No” button remains visible (does not end up off-screen) and does not overlap the “Yes” button permanently.

requirements.text: When the user clicks “Yes”, transition the page into a success state that shows a meme image with the caption text “Good choice”.

quotes:
When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her
"Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” reliably replaces or overlays the initial prompt with a success view.
The success view displays the meme image and the exact text “Good choice”.
After clicking “Yes”, the “No” option is no longer presented as an actionable choice (e.g., hidden/disabled/removed).

requirements.text: Apply a consistent romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, with a simple, polished layout suitable for iPad Chrome (responsive, readable typography, and touch-friendly sizing).

quotes: The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme... easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: Primary palette is pink and white; the UI reads clearly with sufficient contrast.
Layout adapts to common iPad viewport sizes without overflowing or requiring horizontal scrolling.
Buttons are large enough to tap comfortably on a touchscreen.

requirements.text: Establish a cohesive, creative visual direction for the page (e.g., romantic card / scrapbook aesthetic) and apply it consistently across spacing, typography, and decorative elements without adding additional product features beyond the Valentine prompt interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a single coherent style (typography, borders/shadows, background accents) that feels intentionally designed.
No extra features are introduced beyond the Valentine question, Yes/No interaction, and the Yes success/meme state.

requirements.text: Add the required generated image(s) as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them directly from the frontend (not via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
The “Yes” success state loads the meme image from the static assets path and displays it correctly in the UI.

constraints: Frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT must not be edited; compose around them instead.
Do not add or require third-party auth providers or external services.
Keep the solution as a simple single-page experience; no backend functionality is required for the described behavior.
nonGoals: Implementing Internet Identity sign-in or any user accounts.
Adding messaging, email, push notifications, or social sharing.
Adding additional pages, navigation, or features beyond the Valentine prompt and its interactions.

required: Romantic meme image with playful hearts and bold caption text “Good choice” (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png)
